meanings.definition: A name used by an author in place of their own name.
meanings.sent1: The author chose to use allonyms to keep their real name private.
meanings.sent2: Many writers use allonyms when publishing their work.
meanings.sent3: It's like a secret code - allonyms make authors mysterious!
meanings.sent4: In a way, allonyms act as a cloak of invisibility for writers.
meanings.sent5: The use of allonyms adds an air of intrigue to the literary world.

meanings.definition: A pseudonym used by an author.
meanings.sent1: The famous author revealed that their allonyms were carefully chosen.
meanings.sent2: Readers often wonder about the true identity behind an author's allonyms.
meanings.sent3: Using allonyms is like wearing a disguise for writers!
meanings.sent4: The allonyms serve as a mask for the author's true self.
meanings.sent5: The author's allonyms create an aura of mystery around their works.

meanings.definition: A name used by an author to conceal their identity.
meanings.sent1: The author's clever use of allonyms kept their true self hidden.
meanings.sent2: Allonyms are a common tool for authors who wish to remain anonymous.
meanings.sent3: It's like playing hide-and-seek with readers - allonyms keep the author hidden!
meanings.sent4: Allonyms are like a mask that authors wear to disguise themselves.
meanings.sent5: The use of allonyms adds an element of secrecy to the author's persona.
